newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia palm olein stable, trade thin.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia palm olein stable, trade thin.

text.p: Indonesian palm olein prices were mostly stable in late trading on Friday, with demand staying thin amid falls in Malaysia, traders said.

They said palm olein was quoted at 1,385-90 rupiah/kg in Jakarta, unchanged from the opening, but trades were also heard at 1,375-85 rupiah. Crude palm oil was last done at 1,176 rupiah/kg exBelawan at a tender in Medan on Thursday.

"The market was relatively quiet due to the falls in Malaysia which dampened sentiment," one trader said. "I think prices will weaken a little next week before they rebound. Prices are nearing the bottom"

The traders also said it was too early to tell if the El Nino weather pattern forming in the southern Pacific would impact production. A local expert said on Thursday it was unlikely to cause serious damage to crops in Indonesia.
They crude palm oil production picked up significantly late last month and the peak could come over the next few months.

"I have been hearing that production just shot up towards the end of last month," one trader said. "But I don't know if this is because of extensive harvesting after last month's general elections or due to the output cycle." Another trader said some mills were running 24 hours to process fruits.
